title: Games are REALLY one sided.
body: So i can only speak from my experience but finishing the season at gold 1 this seems to be quite common in league games at my division. There is 0 chance of a comeback... every game is a complete stomp either in favor or against. I dunno every game feels like your rolling the dice, if a lane wins you win the game. But if they lose you lose the game. Anyone else seeing this or? Thanks.

replies.body:
Comebacks are definitely possible, you just have to have the right team mates with the right mind set who are willing to listen.

https://imgur.com/a/glSys

I find this less often happens in ranked because it's full of babies who afk after a few "stolen cs" and people who have the mindset of "well this games over lets move on to the next one faster"

My latest game is an example of a major comeback, we were going to surrender but then we had one person say no. Then before we tried to surrender again, had a teamfight where we played perfectly and learnt what we had to do for the rest of this game, combine ults and get rid of the adc first.

Lost literally all of our towers, finally after 40 minutes caught udyr out of position and proceeded to clean the other 4 up in a fight. Pushed mid and won the game.

It really just comes down to the mindset and willingness to listen I find. If your teammates want to win and are willing to communicate, comebacks can happen easily especially because comeback exp is a thing.

Their team was ahead literally the whole game yet we pulled thru, and this happens often when I'm playing with my friends because we always try and think of how we can win, not about how easy it is for us to lose.

Idk if there's much point to this comment, I know it feels awful to keep playing a losing game but I have played too many comeback games I feel like it's almost always worth it to play till the end (unless you get an afk or something lol) JUST TRYING TO INSPIRE PEOPLE TO CONTINUE AGAINST THE ODDS! NEVER GIVE UP! {{champion:497}}

preseason is always like this, the problem i have is I've had more people go afk at the 1-2 min mark this week than i have the last 2 years, it cant be the preseasons fault this it happening but its one hell of a coincidence

It's a know common problem with the MMR system that riot uses, basically it doesn't have a very good relative difference in the system and since your MMR is based on recent games (if you win a lot you will find that you often loose a lot of games right after) it tends to scale too poorly, not to mention that riot only cares about the net MMR not things such as side bias (red side looses quite abit more than blue) and lane bias (which it can only look at in ranked but still). simply put there MMR system is shiite, partly due to the nature of the laning preferences causing undue game times (so it relaxes restrictions) and partly due to the fact that snowballing is an incredibly difficult thing to stop in league. As such the only way I have found to break this (slightly) is to ensure that at least 2 of your own lanes are ahead (roaming, tp ganks and jngling) this generally makes my games feel better but I still HAVE to have a bot side bias (crit scaling is a bitch) and again sometimes they just arn't on the same level (though your teams "even" in an MMR sense)
I feel this but mainly in lower elo (like me), as there is usually someone in the game who gets fed in lane (smurf or something) and snowballs over all the other lanes.
